etymology.description: Pictogram: a house with a roof, a building with three walls (cf. 宀 with four); unrelated to 床, 疒, or ⼚.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a simple shelter or building, evoking the idea of coverage or expanse under a roof. Later it served as the semantic ‘building/space’ element in 廣, whose phonetic is 黃, while the simplified form keeps the pictographic outline and associates with the sense ‘broad, wide’.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by reducing 廣 to its semantic component 广 and dropping the complex phonetic 黃, retaining the roof-and-wall pictographic form.

examples.chinese: 这里的草原很广阔(這裡的草原很廣闊)。
这家公司的业务很广泛(這家公司的業務很廣泛)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngsī de yèwù hěn guǎngfàn.

examples.chinese: 我们在广场散步(我們在廣場散步)。
